markdownRemark.html:
Polkadot Hackthon 2022 Project hosted by One Block & Parity

Staking curating platform in Polkadot ecosytem that recommends our users to have highest profit for staking rewards.

If you want to know what NPoS is check my writing for Polkadot’s NPoS


Goal


Polkadot uses Nominated-Proof-of-Staking that any Dot holders can nominate _validators_ who they trust. Interstingly, all validators get equal rewards regardless of their stake amount. Naturally, percentage of stake over total stake for each validator is different.

For example, let’s say there are two validators A & B. Total stake of A is 1000 DOT and B is 500 DOT. Polkadot pays out equal reward to A and B. If someone wants to stake their DOT, it would be more profitable.

Nominating in NPoS is not “set and forget” operation. Nominator should take care of their nomination intent to be active nominator which is called “Bag Lists” and keep track of their trusted validators frequently which is annoying.

However, for most of the general user, it is hard to understand the system. This is what our team is trying to implement on One Block Hackathon 2022. We want to build a platform that we think the most user-friendly platform as ever. Considering the users’ depth of knowledge, our staking platform not only recommends validators who can give our users highest reward profit but also maintain their position in Bag List by automatically send putInFrontOf extrinsic when user has done bond-more or bond-less which is new staking feature in Polkadot. For considering user-friendly, we are planning to launch our platform on Mobile.


Implementation


  1. New Users import their pre-existed wallet using Mnemonic phrase or json file.

  1. Choose stakeable asset. For Hackathon demo, we are planning to develop ‘WestEnd’ for Substrate chain ‘MoonbaseAlpha’ for EVM chain.

WestEnd

3 options for user.
- Nominator, Nomination Pool

Nominator
- User bonds their asset and nominate validators.
- User can select either curated validators or by their own.

Nomination Pool
- Users join existed pool.
- For the future plan, we are trying to curate Nomination Pool.

MoonbaseAlpha

2 options for user.
- Delegator

Delegator
- User delegates their asset to either curated validators or by their own.

  1. Ask user how many asset to be staked.

    • If users’ amount of staking asset is smaller than minimum bond on the network,
    • Recommend to ‘Nomination Pool’ otherwise ‘Nominator’

  1. Ask users to choose action. Bond

  1. We recommend our curated profitable validators to user.

There are several things about good-validators for each network

WestEnd

1. Comission is lower than 20%
2. Percentage of Own Stake is higher
3. Less Nominators
4. Number of elected based on NPoS
5. Having on-chain identity
6. No Slashing
7. One operator is operating one validator.
8. Performance of block-production

MoonbaseAlpha

1. Performance of block-production
2. Less Delegators

  1. Users stake their asset.

  1. When users opens app. Their stake assets would be presented on our notification spot, we called Control Tower. Here, user can do bond more, scheduled bond less. When users choose one of these actions, we send putInfrontOf extrinsic automatically to put our users proper position in Bag List.
